summary: This is an FBI Daily News Briefing email from May 12, 2023, summarizing news articles from various sources. It covers a wide range of topics including criminal investigations, counterterrorism, and other FBI-related news. A key item relevant to the Epstein case is a report that a Florida appeals court has opened the door for the possible release of grand jury transcripts from the 2006 investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a news item about a Florida appeals court decision that could lead to the release of grand jury investigation transcripts from 2006.

persons.name: Donald W. Hafele
persons.context: Judge who initially ruled he had no authority to release the Epstein grand jury transcripts; his ruling was overturned by an appeals court.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple news items, including one where he suggests he knowingly took documents from the White House, and another where he talks about pardoning Capitol rioters.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Frequently mentioned as the subject of criticism from Republican lawmakers regarding investigations into the Biden family and for defying a congressional subpoena.

persons.name: Hunter Biden
persons.context: Mentioned in news items about an investigation into his overseas business dealings and President Biden's denial of his wrongdoing.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to investigations into his family's business dealings and his comments on his son Hunter.

persons.name: James Comer
persons.context: Chair of the House Oversight Committee who issued a subpoena to the FBI for a document related to an alleged Biden family scheme.

persons.name: Chuck Grassley
persons.context: Mentioned as working with Rep. Comer regarding a subpoena to the FBI and allegations about Hunter Biden.

persons.name: Nancy Mace
persons.context: Criticized Director Wray over the Biden investigation, telling him to 'man up and do your job'.

persons.name: Kevin McCarthy
persons.context: Stated he intends to call Director Wray after the FBI rejected a subpoena from the House Oversight Committee.

persons.name: Christopher Dunham
persons.role: Acting Assistant Director of Congressional Affairs
persons.context: Sent a letter on behalf of Director Wray in response to a congressional subpoena, which was criticized for its tone.

persons.name: Bob Menendez
persons.context: Subject of a criminal investigation that expanded with new subpoenas regarding alleged improper gifts.

persons.name: Nicholas Sacco
persons.context: Reportedly received a subpoena in connection with the federal investigation into Senator Bob Menendez.

persons.name: Jack Smith
persons.context: Appointed by the DOJ to investigate former President Trump's handling of classified documents.

persons.name: Richard Wershe Jr.
persons.context: Known as 'White Boy Rick,' a former FBI informant who was arrested for allegedly punching a woman.

persons.name: William Webster
persons.context: Quoted as a victim of an elder fraud scam, stating 'If it can happen to me, it can happen to you.'

persons.name: Spencer Evans
persons.context: Special Agent in Charge of the FBI Las Vegas bureau, quoted discussing an increase in school social media threats.

persons.name: Bryan Vorndran
persons.context: Assistant Director of the FBI's Cyber Division, quoted on the takedown of the Russian 'Snake' malware network.

connections.description: Comer, as Oversight Committee Chair, issued a subpoena to FBI Director Wray for a document; Wray defied the subpoena.
Senator Grassley sent a letter to Director Wray regarding allegations about Hunter Biden's potential criminal conduct.
Speaker McCarthy stated he intends to call Director Wray after the FBI rejected a congressional subpoena.
Dunham, as Acting Assistant Director, sent a response letter on behalf of Director Wray to Congress.
Mayor Sacco was subpoenaed in the expanding federal investigation into Senator Menendez.
President Biden is the father of Hunter Biden, who is under investigation for overseas business dealings.

events.title: Florida Grand Jury Investigation into Epstein
events.description: A grand jury in Palm Beach County investigated Jeffrey Epstein, resulting in a plea deal criticized as lenient.

events.title: Florida Appeals Court Rules on Epstein Grand Jury Records
events.description: Florida's Fourth District Court of Appeals ruled that a judge erred in not releasing Epstein grand jury transcripts and ordered a review for release to further justice.

events.title: CNN Town Hall with Donald Trump
events.description: Former President Donald Trump appeared in a CNN town hall where he suggested he knowingly took documents from the White House and talked about pardoning Capitol rioters.

events.title: FBI Defies Congressional Subpoena
events.description: The FBI, through Director Wray, defied a subpoena from the House Oversight Committee for a document alleging a criminal scheme involving then-Vice President Biden.

keyFacts: A Florida appeals court has opened the door for the possible release of transcripts from the 2006 grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, which could reveal whether he received special treatment.
The FBI Daily News Briefing is a compilation of news articles from various external media sources, not an internal FBI investigative document.
The document shows significant political pressure on FBI Director Christopher Wray from Republican lawmakers regarding investigations into the Biden family.
The briefing covers a vast array of topics beyond the Epstein case, indicating the wide scope of issues monitored by the FBI's public affairs office.
